channel.title: Social media campaign starts on Facebook
channel.description:
When the Black Mesa facebook page hits 20,000 likes we'll be posting some exciting new media! Care to help?
[url]https://www.facebook.com/BlackMesaDevs[/url]

item.title: Social media campaign starts on Facebook
item.dc:creator: dky.tehkingd.u
item.description:
Kevin Chen is obviously lead dev/project lead.

Cman is just a cover-up.

On-topic: … on second thought, was there even a topic to continue with anyway?

EDIT: Oh yeah. 1080p video. Hopefully soon.

item.title: Social media campaign starts on Facebook
item.dc:creator: jone4s
item.description:
I personally found it a bad idea, that you took this video down, since it was already linked on big games magazine sites, meaning massive free promotion.

It was perfect (showing that black mesa is almost even better than i expected). I’ve watched it approx. 15 times now.

It also made no sense to take it down, since its already uploaded again by other people.

But anyway, you are the developers… the mod is your property, you should know what to do…

greetings

by the way: i do extremely like the ironsight-mode of the magnum

Read full topic

item.source: Social media campaign starts on Facebook

item.title: Social media campaign starts on Facebook
item.dc:creator: Bloodshot
item.description:
lol Ram, you’re getting a lot of hate and speculation because of the forced removal from valvetime

Marphy Black:

Raminator didn’t just “report” the video. He filed a copyright infringement notice against Valve Time. Do any research on it and you’ll find DMCA abuse is a pretty big problem on YouTube given Google’s “take down video first, ask questions later” approach to the policy. I’m willing to bet Raminator is all too aware of it. He’s put Valve Time’s whole YouTube channel in jeopardy literally two strikes away from being banned when he (or anyone on the Black Mesa team) could have simply taken the respectable route of, you know, just asking to take it down. I don’t see anyone rebutting Smash’s claim that they didn’t ask first.

I see very little justification in choosing this manner to take down the video. It’s an outright malicious act just for some petty revenge, yet it’s the Valve community and Valve Time staff members entirely unrelated to the incident that would get hit worst. I happen to know the guy who does the narration for all of Valve Time’s videos (an e-aquantance, if you will, from the Zombie Master days) and I’d hate to see his efforts done entirely for the community go to waste just because of a dumb Black Mesa video war.

Read full topic
item.source: Social media campaign starts on Facebook

item.title: Social media campaign starts on Facebook
item.dc:creator: Rabbiddog
item.description:
Bloodshot:

I WILL SPAM AND REPORT EVERY VIDEO ON YOUTUBE TO TRY AND GET IT TAKEN DOWN

I LOVE YOU

I know it would be the same footage and all, but still. Just the notion of having an official video up there gets me excited - especially considering how many people have actually seen it.

Also, since Joel said that track in the video was replaced, will it be included in the soundtrack release or not?

Ditto!

Read full topic
item.source: Social media campaign starts on Facebook

item.title: Social media campaign starts on Facebook
item.dc:creator: Pepe
item.description:
I found out about the footage from level “On a Rail” by lucky coinincidence, so I downloaded it from Youtube (for some reason streaming video in high quality works crappy on my computer) and watched 4 times in a row.
I specially create an account on this web (but I followed it for a long time) to tell you guys from the developement: THIS IS THE SH*T ! (in positive meaning of course ).
I read some time ago interview with Carlos Montero and I have to say - that’s the “Valve quality” he was talking about ! Who know’s, if rest of your mod keeps similar gameplay level it can beat the original in the opinion of many players.
For now - awesome job guys.

PS. Music from this gameplay brings by some reason memories of good old Unreal 1, which is also awesome

Read full topic

item.title: Social media campaign starts on Facebook
item.dc:creator: Bloodshot
item.description:
^ Pretty much this

I’m curious to see how it actually should look, as well as if there is different music in the new one, or if the track hasn’t been replaced yet.

Because lets face it, if something like this is gonna spread around, better an official video then a leak that tons of people have downloaded and upload in arbitrary places.

Also, notice how 90% of people STILL think this mod is called Black Mesa: Source

Read full topic
